str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Wickedness, iniquities. From poneros; depravity, i.e., malice; plural plots, sins.
From hupokrinomai; an actor under an assumed character, i.e. a dissembler

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To try, tempt, test. From peira; to test, i.e. Endeavor, scrutinize, entice, discipline.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
